Comment: Evidently Pam feels that with the staggering amount of lives saved, 258 Million, we can safely  stop giving [Narcan](https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/americas/us-politics/trump-narcan-overdose-grant-b2739727.html) to our first responders. Even though credited with saving countless lives, evidently we don’t need it anymore. Although [114,000 people died](https://usafacts.org/articles/are-fentanyl-overdose-deaths-rising-in-the-us/) in 2023. Of course the [CDC predicts a 24% decrease in 2024](https://www.cdc.gov/media/releases/2025/2025-cdc-reports-decline-in-us-drug-overdose-deaths.html#:~:text=New%20provisional%20data%20from%20CDC's,activities%20in%20communities%20across%20America.%22) there will still be 87,000 deaths. Still that’s a huge number compared to the 258 Million people saved just in the last 100 days.

Author: absat41

Comment: You know, the funny thing is in high school, he was also the guy that I despised most and yet remained constantly befuddled about how he would seemingly lead students and teachers around by the nose.    An absolute bully, a liar, rich, a braggart, stupid, no morals and yet all of the popular kids, the kids from families  with money, the pretty girls, the cool boys all fucking loved him.  He would say something awful about the kids in the school with disabilities and all the other cool kids would laugh.  He would lie to teachers and not get punished and would cheat on homework or research projects and then brag about getting the A and even about how he cheated to get the A, so long as a teacher wasn't around to hear.  And at home your parents would lecture you about how you should be moral and kind and truthful and you would go to (insert your religion of choice) and hear the same lessons, and then you would go to school and get the same lessons from the teachers yet again and see posters reaffirming the lessons every where in school.  The whole while, utterly befuddled about why after being told these things over and over and over, this guy does the opposite, so do all his friends, and they are all at the top of the social ladder in school and worshipped by all the other kids with less social capital but *desperate* to build more.  And no one ever did anything.  I still don't understand who could possibly support someone like that.
Author: AdventurousSeaSlug
